13  package net.sf.oval.test.constraints;
14  
15  import java.text.DateFormat;
16  import java.util.Calendar;
17  
18  import net.sf.oval.constraint.FutureCheck;
19  
20  /**
21   * @author Sebastian Thomschke
22   */
23  public class FutureTest extends AbstractContraintsTest
24  {
25  	public void testFuture()
26  	{
27  		final FutureCheck check = new FutureCheck();
28  		super.testCheck(check);
29  		assertTrue(check.isSatisfied(null, null, null, null));
30  
31  		Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance();
32  		cal.roll(Calendar.YEAR, 1);
33  		assertTrue(check.isSatisfied(null, cal, null, null));
34  		assertTrue(check.isSatisfied(null, cal.getTime(), null, null));
35  		assertTrue(check.isSatisfied(null, DateFormat.getDateTimeInstance().format(cal.getTime()), null, null));
36  
37  		cal.roll(Calendar.YEAR, -2);
38  		assertFalse(check.isSatisfied(null, cal, null, null));
39  		assertFalse(check.isSatisfied(null, cal.getTime(), null, null));
40  		assertFalse(check.isSatisfied(null, DateFormat.getDateTimeInstance().format(cal.getTime()), null, null));
41  
42  		assertFalse(check.isSatisfied(null, "bla", null, null));
43  	}
44  
45  	public void testTolerance()
46  	{
47  		final FutureCheck check = new FutureCheck();
48  
49  		Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance();
50  		cal.roll(Calendar.SECOND, -2);
51  		assertFalse(check.isSatisfied(null, cal, null, null));
52  		check.setTolerance(1000);
53  		assertFalse(check.isSatisfied(null, cal, null, null));
54  		check.setTolerance(5000);
55  		assertTrue(check.isSatisfied(null, cal, null, null));
56  	}
57  }
This page was automatically generated by Maven
